data.enText: (in developing countries) a group of people of the same race, and with the same customs, language, religion, etc., living in a particular area and often led by a chief

data.chText: 居住在亚马孙河雨林偏远地区的部落
data.enText: tribes living in remote areas of the Amazonian rainforest

data.chText: （尤指同一职业的）一伙（人），一帮（人），一类（人）
data.enText: a group or class of people, especially of one profession

data.chText: 他突然对所有的演员非常反感。
data.enText: He had a sudden outburst against the whole tribe of actors.
a group of related animals or plants

data.chText: 一两个孙子孙女会去那里，但并不是所有的人。
data.enText: One or two of the grandchildren will be there, but not the whole tribe.

means: (尤指同一职业的)一伙(人)，一帮(人)，一类(人)

tr: group of people related by blood or marriage
(biology) a taxonomic category between a genus and a subfamily
a social division of (usually preliterate) people

value.def: Tribe is sometimes used to refer to a group of people of the same race, language, and customs, especially in a developing country. Some people disapprove of this use.

example.ex: …a map of Maryland marked with the names of Indian tribes.
example.tran: 标有印第安部落名称的马里兰州地图

value.tran: (尤指发展中国家的)部落，部族(一些人不赞成此用法)

value.def: You can use tribe to refer to a group of people who are all doing the same thing or who all behave in the same way.

example.tran: 一群群才华出众的年轻人

example.ex: …the particularly unpleasant tribe who argue over the splitting of restaurant and bar bills.
example.tran: 那帮为分摊吃喝账单而争吵的令人非常讨厌的家伙

value.tran: (从事相同活动或行为相同的)一伙(人)，一帮(人)

trans: 表列部族(列在印度宪法第八表的部族，建议在教育和就业方面给予特别帮助)
